card.desc:
We're going to measure the cost per transaction of the following:

- Establishment licence amendment
- Personal licence application

We are establishing baselines through a survey to HOLCs to establish the frequency and time take to complete these transactions. We will then estimate a cost for each of these.

**Baseline** =
- £5.99 for an LO to complete a PIL transaction
- £8.98 for an inspector to complete a PIL transaction
- £109.44 for an inspector to complete a PEL amendment

card.name: ASRU IT support [81 enquiries/month]
card.desc:
Users of ASPeL require a high level of technical support from ASR, including password resets.

We currently set up role holders. Deleting attachments from PPLs.

The new system won't require such a high degree of support.

Anecdotally, 5 password resets per day.

**Baseline** From October 2016 until February 2018:

- 1,380 IT support requests for ASPeL
- in 17 months

- at 81 requests per month

card.name: Cost per transaction (£s)

data.text:
A PIL transaction takes a licensing officer, on average, 10min 20secs to process.

At 58p/min this equals £6 per transaction.


And a PEL amendment takes an inspector, on average, 1hr 36mins to process.

At £1.14/min this equals £109.44 per transaction.

@markstringer2 I think we need three timestamps:

- Time created (ie when the PPL applicant begins the application
- Time complete and correct
- Time granted

And then from these three time stamps I think we can calculate anything we need. Providing we still have a notion of 'complete and correct' in the new world.

card.name: NEW: Users don't (or can't) use the new system

data.text:
@benstevens21 thanks for logging this risk, however the mitigations don't write do it for me. 
The real mitigation is to design and build a system that you *know* the users will use because you have tested it with them.
For every feature or function that we design (and present at standup) we stood be raising this risk and asking how we are mitigating it.
My feeling is that a primary role of the project board is to make sure this is happening.

board.name: Risk Register and KPIs - ASL delivery

card.name: Cost per transaction (£s)
card.desc:
We're going to measure the cost per transaction of the following:

- Establishment licence amendment
- Personal licence application

We are establishing baselines through a survey to HOLCs to establish the frequency and time take to complete these transactions. We will then estimate a cost for each of these.

**Baseline** = Not yet known

Assumption: HOLCs are on an average salary of £35,000 per year, which is about £17 per hour.

board.name: Risk Register and KPIs - ASL delivery

card.name: Increase digital take up
card.desc:
- Establishment licences applications and amendments take place outside of the current system - Word documents are later rekeyed into ASPeL and PDFs are generated.

- Personal Licences are currently all within the ASPeL system.

- Project licences have a maximum 5 year duration. There are still some outside of ASPeL.

- Inspector reports and annual returns of procedures exist outside of the current system.

We will look to support all transactions within a single digital system, and reduce the emailing of documents and licences.

**Baseline** Not yet known. We are looking to establish the total number of transactions and the percentage of those that take place within the system

Project licences: 899 in ASPeL. 1,753 in RASP.
Personal licences: 17,000 in ASPeL
Establishment licences: 168 not in ASPeL

TOTAL: 18,067 licences
In ASPeL: 16,146 (89.36%)
Not in ASPeL: 1,921 (10.63%)

card.name: NEW: Data inconsistencies [exp 2400]
card.desc:
The databases have inconsistent data entries that will be difficult to translate and create structured data from.

Information provided by establishments varies wildly in terms of level of expected completeness (ie XYZ's schedule of premises is 4 rows in a table, whereas ABC's is 720 rows of data. There are potential sensitivities around this information being exposed.

A lot of the data exists on 'additional documents', such as floor plans and 'additional conditions of a PEL'. We will expect establishments that aren't behaving like others, to start behaving like others.

When we clean/normalise (change) the data, will we effectively be issuing an updated licence. Do we need consent from the establishments before we do this?

*Probability (%)* = **60**
*Approx cost (days)* = **40**
*Exposure* = **2400**

card.name: Project licence application time
card.desc:
Currently, the time is measured between an inspector declaring the project proposal 'correct and complete' and the licensing staff approving the licence. However, sometimes a proposal is complete before this artificial status is declared.

We want to reduce the real time between a proposal being complete and a project licence being approved.

**Baseline** Not yet known

board.name: Risk Register and KPIs - ASL delivery

card.name: ASRU IT support
card.desc:
Users of ASPeL require a high level of technical support from ASR, including password resets.

The new system won't require such a high degree of support.

**Baseline** Not yet known

board.name: Risk Register and KPIs - ASL delivery

card.name: Confidence in ASRU
card.desc:
Increased confidence in ASRU among stakeholders is seen as an important objective. A properly designed, tested and built end-to-end digital service is expected to have a positive effect on this metric.

We will establish the baseline metric through a survey to HOLCs, and measure change at regular intervals.

**Baseline** Not yet known

card.name: Increase digital take up
card.desc:
- Establishment licences applications and amendments take place outside of the current system - Word documents are later rekeyed into ASPeL and PDFs are generated.

- Personal Licences are currently all within the ASPeL system.

- Project licences have a maximum 5 year duration. There are still some outside of ASPeL.

- Inspector reports and annual returns of procedures exist outside of the current system.

We will look to support all transactions within a single digital system, and reduce the emailing of documents and licences.

**Baseline** Not yet known. We are looking to establish the total number of transactions and the percentage of those that take place within the system

board.name: Risk Register and KPIs - ASL delivery

card.name: Completion rate
card.desc:
This is usually gathered through the use of Google Analytics. Due to the sensitivity of our service, whether or not we use GA is yet to be decided. However, there are potentially other ways of measuring this.

As some transactions are expected to take place over multiple sessions, we feel measuring the following 'single session' and high volume transactions will be most relevant:

- Amend my establishment licence
- Apply for a personal licence

**Baseline** = we may not be able to measure a baseline for this

board.name: Risk Register and KPIs - ASL delivery

card.name: User satisfaction
card.desc:
This question is asked on all new digital services hosted on GOV.UK. When our service moves to GOV.UK we will ask the question there to monitor performance over time.

To establish a baseline, we have asked the same question in the survey we have sent to HOLCs. The question being: *Overall, how do you feel about the service you receive through ASPeL?*

**Baseline**
- Very satisfied = Not yet known
- Satisfied = Not yet known
- Neither satisfied or dissatisfied = Not yet known
- Dissatisfied = Not yet know
- Very dissatisfied = Not yet known

board.name: Risk Register and KPIs - ASL delivery

card.name: Cost per transaction (£s)
card.desc:
We're going to measure the cost per transaction of the following:

- Establishment licence amendment
- Personal licence application

We are establishing baselines through a survey to HOLCs to establish the frequency and time take to complete these transactions. We will then estimate a cost for each of these.

**Baseline** = Not yet known

cards.desc:
We're going to measure the cost per transaction of the following:

- Establishment licence amendment
- Personal licence application

We are establishing baselines through a survey to HOLCs to establish the frequency and time take to complete these transactions. We will then estimate a cost for each of these.

**Baseline** =
- £5.99 for an LO to complete a PIL transaction
- £8.98 for an inspector to complete a PIL transaction
- £109.44 for an inspector to complete a PEL amendment
cards.name: Cost per transaction (£s) [£6/hr and £109/hr]

cards.desc:
This question is asked on all new digital services hosted on GOV.UK. When our service moves to GOV.UK we will ask the question there to monitor performance over time.

To establish a baseline, we have asked the same question in the survey we have sent to HOLCs. The question being: *Overall, how do you feel about the service you receive through ASPeL?*

**Baseline**
- Very satisfied = Not yet known
- Satisfied = Not yet known
- Neither satisfied or dissatisfied = Not yet known
- Dissatisfied = Not yet know
- Very dissatisfied = Not yet known
cards.name: User satisfaction [73.4%]

cards.desc:
Increased confidence in ASRU among stakeholders is seen as an important objective. A properly designed, tested and built end-to-end digital service is expected to have a positive effect on this metric.

We will establish the baseline metric through a survey to HOLCs, and measure change at regular intervals.

**Baseline** Not yet known
cards.name: Confidence in ASRU [79.6%]

cards.desc:
Users of ASPeL require a high level of technical support from ASR, including password resets.

We currently set up role holders. Deleting attachments from PPLs.

The new system won't require such a high degree of support.

Anecdotally, 5 password resets per day.

**Baseline** From October 2016 until February 2018:

- 1,380 IT support requests for ASPeL
- in 17 months

- at 81 requests per month
cards.name: ASRU IT support [81 enquiries/month]

Information provided by establishments varies wildly in terms of level of expected completeness (ie XYZ's schedule of premises is 4 rows in a table, whereas ABC's is 720 rows of data. There are potential sensitivities around this information being exposed.

A lot of the data exists on 'additional documents', such as floor plans and 'additional conditions of a PEL'. We will expect establishments that aren't behaving like others, to start behaving like others.

cards.desc:
- Establishment licences applications and amendments take place outside of the current system - Word documents are later rekeyed into ASPeL and PDFs are generated.

- Personal Licences are currently all within the ASPeL system.

- Project licences have a maximum 5 year duration. There are still some outside of ASPeL.

- Inspector reports and annual returns of procedures exist outside of the current system.

We will look to support all transactions within a single digital system, and reduce the emailing of documents and licences.

**Baseline** Not yet known. We are looking to establish the total number of transactions and the percentage of those that take place within the system

Project licences: 899 in ASPeL. 1,753 in RASP.
Personal licences: 17,000 in ASPeL
Establishment licences: 168 not in ASPeL

TOTAL: 18,067 licences
In ASPeL: 16,146 (89.36%)
Not in ASPeL: 1,921 (10.63%)
